scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible churn prediction model deployed by a consumer banking institution.  The attacker uses a model inversion attack to infer customer income levels and credit scores, violating customer privacy and potentially facilitating financial fraud.
initial_goal: Gain insight into the distribution of customer income and credit scores within the bank's customer base.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A large national bank uses a machine learning model to predict customer churn probability. The model is accessed through a publicly facing prediction API without sufficient input validation and output sanitization.
